intro: Brassaia catanduanensis, commonly known as the Catanduanes bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions and forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
